caseName: Federal Energy Regulatory Commission v. Vitol Inc

recap_documents.description: ORDER  signed by Chief District Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 12/20/2021 GRANTING-IN-PART  31  &  54  Requests for Judicial Notice, DENYING  30   Motion to Dismiss, GRANTING-IN-PART  33   Motion to Dismiss and DENYING  36   Motion to Stay as moot.  Co rteggiano's   33  Motion to Dismiss is GRANTED-IN-PART to the extent the court holds that FERC may not at this time pursue a  greater penalty than the previously proposed penalty of $800,000.  Corteggiano's   33  motion is otherwise DENIED. Within 14 days from the date of this order, the parties are DIRECTED to Meet and Confer and file a Supplemental Joint Status Report. (Donati, J)

recap_documents.description: ORDER in case 1:96-cv-05238-JG-JO; granting (2111) Motion for Settlement in case 1:05-md-01720-JG-JO. For the reasons given in the attached order, the Court certifies the Rule 23(b)(2) and (b)(3) classes for settlement purposes and approves the settlement, with one minor modification as described. The Court defers decision on, and will issue a separate order on, the 2113 matter of attorneys' fees and costs. A status conference will be held on January 10, 2014 at 3:00 PM to discuss next steps in the case in courtroom 6C South before Judge John Gleeson. Ordered by Judge John Gleeson on 12/13/2013. Associated Cases: 1:05-md-01720-JG-JO et al. (Aronoff, Peter) (Entered: 12/13/2013)
